Name: Unexpected Shift
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: Your supernatural connection sometimes causes you to phase from reality when under threat, disappearing for split seconds before reappearing—often surprising you as much as your enemies.

Name: Unfetter Eidolon
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can allow your eidolon to travel far from your side.

Name: Unfettered Halfling
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You were forced into service as a laborer, but you’ve since escaped and have trained to ensure you’ll never be caught again.

Name: Unimpeded Step
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: With a burst of divine liberation, your spur your ally’s movement.

Name: Unwavering Mien
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your mystic control and meditations allow you to resist external influences upon your consciousness.

Name: Vampire Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You were raised by your vampiric parent, or you've invested substantial time and energy researching the secrets of your undead progenitors.

Name: Vanth's Weapon Familiarity
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: You seek to emulate vanth reapers' fighting styles.

Name: Veil May
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: Born of a blood hag, a fiery blood drinker hidden behind a false skin, you have one blood-red eye and the ability to slough off your appearance in an instant.

Name: Vengeful Hatred
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people.

Name: Verdant Weapon
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You cultivate a seed that can sprout into a wooden staff, vine whip, or another weapon.

Name: Versatile Performance
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can rely on the grandeur of your performances rather than ordinary social skills.

Name: Very Sneaky
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Taller folk rarely pay attention to the shadows at their feet, and you take full advantage of this.

Name: Vestigial Wings
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: You possess small, weak wings that aid in balance.

Name: Vibrant Display
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: Whereas most gnomes’ coloration is static or changes slowly, you can cause your hair, eye, and skin color to scintillate in brief and disorienting bursts.

Name: Vicious Incisors
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've let your incisors grow long enough to serve as formidable weapons.

Name: Vicious Vengeance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: While your vengeance is painful for both you and your foe, none can doubt that your enemies suffer more.

Name: Vigorous Health
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: Your physique is robust and can withstand blood loss startlingly well.

Name: Viking Shieldbearer
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself.

Name: Vile Desecration
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You combine unholy might with negative energy to damage angels, archons, and other self-righteous denizens of the Outer Planes.

Name: Virga May
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: Born of a storm hag, you have one crystal-blue or rain-gray eye.

Name: Virtuosic Performer
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: +1 with a certain type of performance.

Name: Voice of the Night
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You hear and understand the words of creatures you share the darkness with.

Name: Warren Friend
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: You're adept at making contact with other ysoki.

Name: Warren Navigator
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're particularly good at solving mazes and navigating twists and turns.

Name: Watchful Gaze
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You use your many eyes to look in all directions at once, making you extremely observant for a short period of time.

Name: Watchful Halfling
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your communal lifestyle causes you to pay close attention to the people around you.

Name: Waxed Feathers
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: Your feathers are coated in a waxy substance that repels water.

Name: Weapon Proficiency
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Become trained in a weapon type.

Name: Web Walker
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have plenty of practice navigating webs.

Name: Web Weaver
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You can produce a soft silk to weave into useful items.

Name: Weight of Guilt
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Guilt clouds the minds of those who ignore your Glimpse of Redemption.

Name: Well-Met Traveler
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have seen people from so many walks of life in your travels that you naturally adopt a pleasant and affable demeanor when meeting others.

Name: Well-Versed
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're resilient to performative influences that aren't your own.

Name: Widen Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to spread out and affect a wider area.

Name: Wild Shape
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You are one with the wild, always changing and adapting to meet any challenge.

Name: Wildborn Magic
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You have learned to access the old magic of wild places.

Name: Willing Death
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: Once, you died because you valued someone else's life above your own; just as then, you protect an ally by suffering in their stead.

Name: Wind Tempered
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: You are at home in tempestuous weather and accustomed to even the harshest winds.

Name: Winter Cat Senses
Source: Ancestry Guide
Benefits: Your eyes are keen and accustomed to winter conditions.

Name: Witch Warden
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You and your family have fought long and hard against witches, particularly the winter witches of Irrisen, and you’ve learned to be wary of their curses and the otherworldly powers their patrons grant.

Name: Wolf Stance
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth.

Name: Woodcraft
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You have a innate familiarity with forested areas.

Name: Wortwitch
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a particular affinity for leafy plants.

Name: You're Next
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: After downing a foe, you menacingly remind another foe that you’re coming after them next.

Name: Acrobat Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You become an expert in Acrobatics.

Name: Acute Scent
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: When you Rage, your sense of smell improves.

Name: After You
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You allow your foes to make the first move in a show of incredible confidence.

Name: Aggressive Block
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You push back as you block the attack, knocking your foe away or off balance.

Name: Alacritous Action
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon moves more quickly.

Name: Alchemist Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Become a multiclass alchemist.

Name: Aldori Duelist Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: trained in Aldori dueling swords
Benefits: Increase your dedication and training to the Aldori dueling sword.

Name: Amphibious Form
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon adapts to life on land and underwater.

Name: Ancestral Weaponry
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Monastic Weaponry; a feat granting access to all weapons with an ancestry trait (such as elf or orc)
Benefits: You blend monastic techniques with the ancestral fighting styles of your people.

Name: Animal Trainer Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #152
Benefits: You gain a young animal companion.

Name: Anoint Ally
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You forge a mystical connection with an ally using your body as a focus, allowing them to benefit from your magic.

Name: Antagonize
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your taunts and threats earn your foes ire.

Name: Archaeologist Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in Perception; trained in Society and Thievery
Benefits: You are a student of peoples and their histories, and are in constant pursuit of knowledge and artifacts from the past.

Name: Archer Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You become trained in all simple and martial weapons in the bow weapon group.

Name: Armored Stealth
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Reduce the Stealth penalty of your armor.

Name: Assassin Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Alchemical Crafting; trained in Crafting, Deception, and Stealth
Benefits: You've trained to assassinate your foes, and you do so with tenacity and precision.

Name: Assisting Shot
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: With a quick shot, you interfere with a foe in combat.

Name: Assured Identification
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: expert in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: Avoid misidentifying magic.

Name: Athletic Strategist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know how to calculatedly manipulate joints and body weight.

Name: Automatic Knowledge
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: expert in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action; Assurance in that skill
Benefits: Recall Knowledge as a free action once per round.

Name: Backup Disguise
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You have a specific disguise that you keep at the ready, worn underneath your outer garment.

Name: Barbarian Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Become a multiclass barbarian.

Name: Bard Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Become a multiclass bard.

Name: Bashing Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You smash, bust, and charge through solid obstacles without hesitation.

Name: Basic Lesson
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your patron grants you a special lesson, revealing a hidden facet of its nature.

Name: Bastion Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are particularly skilled at using a shield in combat.

Name: Battle Planner
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Make a battle plan and roll Warfare Lore for initiative.

Name: Beastmaster Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you and obeys your commands.

Name: Blessed One Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are touched by a deity and gifted with the ability to alleviate the suffering of others.

Name: Bonded Animal
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: An animal becomes permanently helpful to you.

Name: Bounty Hunter Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When focused on finding your quarry, you're relentless.

Name: Brawling Focus
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You know how to make the most of your attacks when fighting hand-to-hand.

Name: Bright Lion Dedication
Source: Legends
Prerequisites: member of the Bright Lions; not a worshipper of Walkena; trained in Stealth
Benefits: You are one of the Bright Lions, part revolutionary warrior, part undercover spy.

Name: Brutal Beating
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: The brutality of your critical hits shakes your foes’ confidence.

Name: Brutish Shove
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Throwing your weight behind your attack, you hit you opponent hard enough to make it stumble back.

Name: Call of the Wild
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You call upon the creatures of nature to come to your aid.

Name: Cantrip Casting
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You increase your ability to cast simple spells.

Name: Cantrip Expansion
Source: Secrets of Magic
Traits: Bard, Cleric, Magus, Oracle, Sorcerer, Witch, Wizard
Benefits: Study broadens your range of simple spells.

Name: Cathartic Mage Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: Charisma 14 or ability to cast spells from spell slots
Benefits: You've learned to harness a particular emotion and mix it into your magic.

Name: Cavalier Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain a young animal companion that serves as your mount.

Name: Celebrity Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The more people you have looking at you, the more content you are.

Name: Champion Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass champion.

Name: Charmed Life
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When danger calls, you have a strange knack for coming out on top.

Name: Cleric Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass cleric.

Name: Clever Gambit
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your battle tactics are aided by your assessment of your foes' capabilities, allowing you to instantly adjust your movements to maximum advantage.

Name: Combat Grab
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You swipe at your opponent and grab at them.

Name: Communal Healing
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’re a conduit for positive energy, and as you channel it through you, it heals some of your minor injuries.

Name: Conceal Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Hiding your gestures and incantations within other speech and movement, you attempt to conceal the fact that you are casting a spell.

Name: Conceited Mindset
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Because you know your mind is superior, you scoff at anyone who would alter your mental state—but this hubris gets the better of you when you're wrong.

Name: Confabulator
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Reduce the bonuses against your repeated lies.

Name: Connections
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Leverage your connections for favors and meetings.

Name: Continual Recovery
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Treat Wounds on a patient more often.

Name: Criminal Connections
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Leverage your underworld connections for favors from criminals.

Name: Crushing Grab
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Like a powerful constrictor, you crush targets in your unyielding grasp.

Name: Dancing Leaf
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You are as light as a leaf whirling in the breeze.

Name: Dandy Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are a consummate student of dignity, etiquette, and fashion.

Name: Demolition Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can rig your bombs to inanimate objects in order to cause destruction to the surrounding area.

Name: Directed Audience
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can shape the area of your composition spells.

Name: Discreet Inquiry
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Gather Information without revealing your motive.

Name: Distracting Feint
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your Feints are far more distracting than normal, drawing your foes’ attention and allowing you and your allies to take greater advantage.

Name: Distracting Performance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Create a Diversion for an ally.

Name: Divine Aegis
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You summon divine energy to shield yourself, offering protection against other traditions but leaving you exposed to other divine effects.

Name: Divine Grace
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You call upon your deity’s grace.

Name: Domain Acumen
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Every oracle's mystery touches on a divine domain of the deities that fuel it; you can access that power.

Name: Dragging Strike
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You aim your weapon to snag a foe's armor, clothing, or flesh to pull them closer.

Name: Dragon Disciple Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You choose to study or worship one type of dragon, and your focus grants you a measure of its power.

Name: Dragonslayer Oath
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’ve sworn to slay evil dragons.

Name: Drow Shootist Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #165
Prerequisites: trained in the hand crossbow
Benefits: Every chance you get, you practice with the hand crossbow to increase your draw speed and accuracy.

Name: Druid Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass druid.

Name: Dual-Weapon Warrior Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're exceptional in your use of two weapons.

Name: Dueling Parry (Fighter)
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can parry attacks against you with your one-handed weapon.

Name: Duelist Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in light armor and simple weapons
Benefits: You are always ready to draw your weapon and begin a duel, no matter the circumstances.

Name: Edgewatch Detective Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #157
Benefits: You're a specially trained detective for the Edgewatch guard precinct in Absalom.

Name: Eldritch Researcher Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #164
Benefits: An eager student of occult lore, you enjoy reading rare or forgotten tomes with ancient rituals and hidden secrets.

Name: Elemental Fist
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You call upon the power of the elements, infusing your ki with elemental energy and allowing your attacks to deal energy damage.

Name: Elementalist Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Each day when you make your daily preparations, you can attune yourself to one element of your choice: air, earth, fire, or water.

Name: Embed Aeon Stone
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You discover the secrets to embedding aeon stones into your flesh.

Name: Emblazon Armament
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Carefully etching a sacred image into a physical object, you steel yourself for battle.

Name: Encouraging Words
Source: Gamemastery Guide
Benefits: You give an ally a quick pep talk, helping them recover.

Name: Energy Ablation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you cast energy spells, you retain some of that energy as a protective barrier.

Name: Enhanced Familiar
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You infuse your familiar with additional primal energy, increasing its abilities.

Name: Entreat with Forebears
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: a bloodline that corresponds with a creature trait
Benefits: Something about your presence causes creatures of your bloodline to, consciously or not, recognize you as one of their own, and you become inured to their tricks.

Name: Esoteric Oath
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've sworn an oath to slay the alien abominations that lurk in the remote corners of Golarion.

Name: Esoteric Polymath
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You keep a book of occult spells, similar to a wizard’s spellbook.

Name: Exhort the Faithful
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: follower of a specific religion; expert in Religion
Benefits: +2 to Request something of or Coerce members of your own faith.

Name: Expansive Spellstrike
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You've adapted a wider array of spells to work with your attacks.

Name: Eye of the Arclords
Source: World Guide
Benefits: The Arclords of Nex have achieved a unique mastery of magic.

Name: Familiar Master Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have forged a mystical bond with a creature.

Name: Familiar's Language
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned to speak with your familiar and other creatures like it.

Name: Fane's Fourberie
Source: PFS Guide
Benefits: Stella Fane has perfected a technique for using playing cards as weapons that's one part sleight of hand and one part magic.

Name: Favored Terrain
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You have studied a specific terrain to overcome its challenges.

Name: Fiendsbane Oath
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’ve sworn an oath to banish the corruption of fiends to the dark planes they call home.

Name: Fighter Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become trained in simple weapons and martial weapons.

Name: Finishing Follow-Through
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Finishing a foe maintains your swagger.

Name: Flexible Spellcaster Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You now have four cantrips per day instead of three.

Name: Folklorist Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: You are a master archivist and entertainer, capable of pulling wisdom from the tales you tell and weaving your allies and enemies into a powerful narrative.

Name: Force Fang
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can turn your attack into an unerring blur of force.

Name: Fresh Ingredients
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When using Natural Medicine to Treat Wounds, you can spend a batch of herbs to gain the +2 circumstance bonus from having fresh ingredients, even if not in wilderness.

Name: Furious Finish
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Desperate to finish the fight, you pour all your rage into one final blow.

Name: Geomancer Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: ability to cast spells from spell slots; at least one spell with the air, cold, earth, fire, plant, or water trait; trained in Nature
Benefits: You feel a deep connection to the world no matter where you are, a phenomenon known as “terrain attunement.” When you expend a spell slot to cast a spell with a trait that corresponds to the type of terrain you are currently in (as listed below), you gain the terrain attunement effect for that type of terrain.

Name: Ghost Eater Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You have trained as a ghost eater, a hunter specialized in the destruction of spirits.

Name: Ghost Hunter Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #163
Benefits: You have focused your training on hunting and defeating ghosts, spirits, and all manner of haunts.

Name: Glad-Hand
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Make an Impression on a target you've just met.

Name: Gladiator Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know how to turn combat into a form of entertainment.

Name: Godless Healing
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: Battle Medicine; can't have a patron deity
Benefits: With limited access to divine healing magic, Rahadoumi often become adept at using ordinary medicine for when dangerous situations arise.

Name: Hellknight Armiger Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: member of a Hellknight Order; trained in heavy armor as well as your order's favored weapon
Benefits: You have taken the first step to being a full Hellknight.

Name: Herbalist Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can create remedies and other herbal products.

Name: Horizon Walker Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've mastered travel within a specific type of terrain.

Name: Hunter's Aim
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: When you focus on aiming, your attack becomes particularly accurate.

Name: Inspire Competence
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You learn to aid your allies’ skills with your performance.

Name: Intimidating Prowess
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Gain a bonus to physically Demoralize a target.

Name: Intimidating Strike
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence.

Name: Investigator Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the on the case class feature, which grants you both the Pursue a Lead activity and Clue In reaction.

Name: Juggle
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: You can Juggle items and still use your hands between tosses.

Name: Juggler Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: You become trained in Performance and gain the Juggle skill feat

Name: Lasting Coercion
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Coerce a target into helping you longer.

Name: Lastwall Sentry Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: member of the Knights of Lastwall; Shield Block
Benefits: Swear yourself as a sentry for the Knights of Lastwall.

Name: Lead Climber
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Make Climbing safer for allies who Follow the Expert.

Name: Lightslayer Oath
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've sworn to rid the world of the self-righteousness of celestial beings.

Name: Linguist Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: you speak at least three languages
Benefits: You have studied languages and their development.

Name: Lion Blade Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: member of the Lion Blades; trained in Performance
Benefits: You are a Lion Blade, an elite spy in the service of Taldor.

Name: Living Hair
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can instantly grow or shrink your hair, eyebrows, beard, or mustache by up to several feet and manipulate your hair for use as a weapon, though your control isn't fine enough for more dexterous tasks.

Name: Living Monolith Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: Ancient Osiriani and Sphinx languages; trained in Crafting
Benefits: Begin to process to become a living monolith.

Name: Loremaster Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in at least one skill to Decipher Writing
Benefits: You've compiled a vast repository of information that touches on nearly every subject.

Name: Loremaster's Etude
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You magically unlock memories, making them easier to recall.

Name: Lunge
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Extending your body to its limits, you attack an enemy that would normally be beyond your reach.

Name: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication
Source: Character Guide
Prerequisites: member of the Magaambya of attendant rank; trained in Arcana or Nature
Benefits: You devote much of your study to halcyon magic.

Name: Magic Hide
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can defend your companion in battle.

Name: Magic Warrior Dedication
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You have taken up a nameless mask and sworn the oath of the magic warriors.

Name: Magical Crafting
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Craft magic items.

Name: Magical Shorthand
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: expert in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: Learn spells quickly and at a reduced cost.

Name: Magical Understudy
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon evolves to cast spells.

Name: Magus Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You cast spells like a magus, gaining a spellbook with four common arcane cantrips of your choice.

Name: Marshal Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in martial weapons; trained in Diplomacy or Intimidation
Benefits: You've combined your social skills and combat training to become a talented combat leader.

Name: Martial Artist Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have trained to use your fists as deadly weapons.

Name: Mauler Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You specialize in weapons that require two hands.

Name: Medic Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You become an expert in Medicine.

Name: Minor Magic
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’ve dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities from a particular tradition.

Name: Mobility
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You move in a way that denies your enemies the opportunity to retaliate.

Name: Monk Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass monk.

Name: Monster Warden
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You understand how to defend yourself and others against your prey.

Name: Mortal Healing
Source: Gods & Magic
Prerequisites: Godless Healing, you follow the Laws of Mortality
Benefits: You grant greater healing when the gods don’t interfere

Name: Multifarious Muse
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your muse doesn’t fall into a single label.

Name: Nantambu Chime-Ringer Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: You've studied the basics of harmony and resonance in magic, exemplified by the ringing of chimes.

Name: Nimble Crawl
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Crawl at a faster rate.

Name: No Escape
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You keep pace with a retreating foe.

Name: Nonlethal Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can alter offensive spells to be less deadly.

Name: Oozemorph Dedication
Source: The Slithering
Benefits: You are plagued by sporadic anatomical rearrangements, which grant you insights into other creatures with unusual anatomies.

Name: Oracle Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Choose an oracle mystery.

Name: Order Explorer
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order.

Name: Pathfinder Agent Dedication
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You're a field agent of the globe-trotting Pathfinder Society.

Name: Pirate Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: As a pirate, you sail the seas in search of enemy ships to plunder.

Name: Poison Resistance
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Repeated exposure to toxic reagents has fortified your body against poisons of all kinds.

Name: Poisoner Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make a point of always having a few toxins near at hand—you never know when some arsenic or the like might prove useful.

Name: Powerful Leap
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Jump farther and higher.

Name: Quick Contacts
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Connections or Underworld Connections; expert in Society
Benefits: Spend only 1 day to use Connections or Underworld Connections.

Name: Quick Disguise
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Set up a disguise in only half the time.

Name: Quick Draw
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion.

Name: Quiet Allies
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Roll a single Stealth check when sneaking with allies.

Name: Ranged Combatant
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance.

Name: Ranger Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass ranger.

Name: Rapid Mantel
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Pull yourself onto ledges quickly.

Name: Rapid Response
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You work quickly and efficiently in times of danger to deliver needed assistance.

Name: Rebounding Toss
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You bounce your weapon off one foe to strike another.

Name: Red Herring
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a keen sense for avoiding spurious lines of inquiry.

Name: Red Mantis Assassin Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: trained in sawtooth sabers; worshipper of Achaekek; lawful evil alignment; member of the Red Mantis assassins
Benefits: Dedicate yourself to the assassins of Achaekek.

Name: Reinforce Eidolon
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You buffer your eidolon.

Name: Relentless Stalker
Source: The Fall of Plaguestone
Benefits: Stay adjacent to your prey when they attempt to move away.

Name: Revivifying Mutagen
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: While under the effect of a mutagen, you can metabolize that mutagen’s power to heal yourself.

Name: Robust Recovery
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Greater benefits from Treat Disease and Treat Poison.

Name: Rogue Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass rogue.

Name: Runelord Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your rune magic increases, and you practice with your school's associated weapon.

Name: Runescarred Dedication
Source: World Guide
Benefits: Overwhelming magic has branded your body with powerful runes.

Name: Sap Life
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You draw the life force out of your enemies to heal your own wounds.

Name: Scout Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are a highly skilled scout, capable of providing your allies a timely warning of any danger.

Name: Scroll Trickster Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: You've studied scrolls in depth.

Name: Scrounger Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can Craft items even without appropriate tools or a workshop, though you take a –2 item penalty to your Crafting check.

Name: Second Wind
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can enter a second rage, but afterward you need to catch your breath.

Name: Sentinel Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have trained carefully to maximize the protective qualities of your armor.

Name: Shadow Mark
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Targets you’re following take a penalty to notice you.

Name: Shadowcaster Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You've sacrificed a piece of your spirit, allowing the powers of shadow into your being and changing the nature of your magic.

Name: Shake it Off
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You concentrate on your rage, overcoming fear and fighting back sickness.

Name: Shared Stratagem
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The plans you make include your allies as well as yourself.

Name: Shining Oath
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’ve sworn an oath to put the undead to rest.

Name: Shooting Stars Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You enter a stance that lets you throw shuriken with lightning speed.

Name: Smoke Bomb
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You cause the bomb to create a cloud of thick smoke, in addition to its normal effects.

Name: Snare Hopping
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can magically move your snares around.

Name: Snarecrafter Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned to create a limited number of snares at no cost.

Name: Solid Lead
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Sometimes your case splinters into smaller mysteries, but you never lose sight of the big picture.

Name: Song of Strength
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your performances inspire strength in your allies.

Name: Sorcerer Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass sorcerer.

Name: Soulforger Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: Wisdom 14 or ability to cast divine spells
Benefits: You can manifest the power of your spirit in combat to realize your motivations.

Name: Sow Rumor
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You spread rumors, which may or may not be true, about a specific subject.

Name: Spell Parry
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You infuse magical power into your body or armaments to parry both physical and magical assaults.

Name: Spirit Sheath
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You've magically constructed an extradimensional sheath for your weapon that you access through your clothing, typically through a pocket, sleeve, or seam.

Name: Staff Acrobat Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #151
Prerequisites: trained with at least one of the following weapons: staff, bo staff, halfling sling staff, or any weapon in the spear or polearm group (referred to in this archetype as “your staff”); Dexterity 16; trained in Acrobatics and Athletics
Benefits: Gain bonuses when using your staff as an implement to aid Acrobatics and Athletics actions.

Name: Steed Form
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon changes to make it particularly effective as your mount.

Name: Strong Arm
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you Strike with a thrown weapon, the weapon's range increment increases 10 feet.

Name: Student of Perfection Dedication
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: powerful fist or expert in unarmed attacks; member of a House of Perfection
Benefits: You have joined one of the Houses of Perfection.

Name: Stunning Fist
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: The focused power of your flurry threatens to overwhelm your opponent.

Name: Summoner Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You've formed a bond with an eidolon, an entity that manifests in a physical body only through its link to your life force.

Name: Swashbuckler Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Choose a swashbuckler style.

Name: Talisman Dabbler Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are trained in the use of talismans and similar magical paraphernalia.

Name: Tattoo Artist
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can craft tattoos, including magical tattoos.

Name: Terrifying Resistance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: +1 to spell saves from a creature you’ve Demoralized.

Name: Tumble Behind (Swashbuckler)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your tumbling catches your foe off guard.

Name: Turn Undead
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Undead harmed by your positive energy might flee, compelled by an innate aversion to the force opposite undeath.

Name: Turpin Rowe Lumberjack Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #153
Benefits: Your logging training has made you intimately familiar with all aspects of forestry.

Name: Tweak Appearances
Source: Pathfinder #147
Benefits: You can alter a creature's clothing to improve their social impact.

Name: Unbalancing Blow
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Interweaving your most powerful attacks in a graceful flow, you temporarily unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

Name: Unbalancing Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attack with a flashy assault that leaves your target off balance.

Name: Underground Network
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Gather Information without drawing attention and gain a bonus to Recall Knowledge about that subject.

Name: Underhanded Assault
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You capitalize on the distraction provided by an ally.

Name: Unmistakable Lore
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Recall Knowledge about your Lore more effectively.

Name: Vengeful Oath
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’ve sworn an oath to hunt down wicked evildoers and bring them to judgment.

Name: Versatile Font
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: harmful font or healing font; deity that allows clerics to have both fonts
Benefits: As you explore your deity’s aspects, you move beyond restrictions on healing or harming.

Name: Vigilante Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have two identities, each with its own name, alignment, and abilities.

Name: Viking Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Vikings spend long periods of time at sea, only to leap from their boats at a moment's notice, charge through the surf, and take their enemies by storm.

Name: Ward Medic
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Treat several patients at once.

Name: Wary Disarmament
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: +2 to AC or saves against devices or traps you trigger while disarming.

Name: Weapon Improviser Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You don't take the normal –2 penalty to attack rolls with improvised weapons.

Name: Wellspring Mage Dedication
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: There's no longer a limit on how many temporary spell slots you can gain per day from wellspring magic.

Name: Wild Empathy
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world.

Name: Wilderness Spotter
Source: The Fall of Plaguestone
Benefits: Use Survival for your Initiative when in a specific terrain.

Name: Witch Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You cast spells like a witch.

Name: Wizard Dedication
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You become a multiclass wizard

Name: Zephyr Guard Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #149
Benefits: As a Zephyr Guard, you’re always vigilant against crime and threats to the city’s safety.

Name: Additional Circus Trick
Source: Come One, Come All, to the Extinction Curse Player’s Guide!
Prerequisites: You must have a signature trick
Benefits: You gain an additional signature trick.

Name: Ancestral Paragon
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Gain a 1st-level ancestry feat.

Name: Hireling Manager
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Hirelings gain +2 to skill checks.

Name: Improvised Repair
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Quickly patch a broken item.

Name: Keen Follower
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Improve bonuses when you Follow the Expert.

Name: Know the Beat
Source: Pathfinder #149
Benefits: You have been trained to investigate crimes.

Name: Pick up the Pace
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your group can Hustle for up to 20 minutes longer.

Name: Prescient Planner
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Procure a piece of adventuring gear.

Name: Skitter
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Crawl up to half your Speed.

Name: Steel Your Resolve
Source: Gamemastery Guide
Benefits: Regain Stamina Points equal to half your maximum.

Name: Thorough Search
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: +2 to Perception when you spend twice as long Searching.

Name: Untrained Improvisation
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Become more adept at using untrained skills.

Name: Accelerating Touch
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: devotion spell (lay on hands)
Benefits: Your healing energies are infused with bounding energy.

Name: Acclimatization
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your time spent in the hostile parts of the world has inured you to extreme climates.

Name: Additional Companion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Another animal joins you in your travels.

Name: Aeon Resonance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain the resonant power of one embedded aeon stone as if it were placed in a wayfinder.

Name: Alchemical Discoveries
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've devoted extra time in the lab to improve your knowledge of alchemy.

Name: Aldori Parry
Source: World Guide
Benefits: Increase your AC while wielding an Aldori dueling sword.

Name: Animal Feature
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are so connected with the animal world that you can grant yourself an animal's features and abilities.

Name: Arcane Evolution
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your arcane legacy grants you an exceptional aptitude for intellectual and academic pursuits.

Name: Arcane School Spell
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Select one arcane school of magic.

Name: Ardent Armiger
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You have been trained to resist the manipulations of fiends.

Name: Attunement Shift
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: The magic of your spell floods into you, overriding your connection to the land around you.

Name: Aura of Courage
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You stand strong in the face of danger and inspire your allies to do the same.

Name: Aura of Despair
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your presence as an avatar of evil makes your foes more susceptible to terror and makes it almost impossible for them to shake off fear when you are near.

Name: Axe Climber
Source: Pathfinder #153
Benefits: You can climb wooden surfaces using axes.

Name: Barbarian Resiliency
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: Barbarian Dedication; class granting no more Hit Points per level than 10 + your Constitution modifier
Benefits: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each barbarian archetype class feat you have.

Name: Barreling Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You rush forward, moving enemies aside to reach your foe.

Name: Basic Arcana
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level wizard feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Bard Spellcasting
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits for bard spellcasting.

Name: Basic Blood Potency
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level sorcerer feat.

Name: Basic Bloodline Spell
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain your bloodline's initial bloodline spell.

Name: Basic Cathartic Spellcasting
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

Name: Basic Cleric Spellcasting
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits of cleric spellcasting.

Name: Basic Concoction
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level alchemist feat.

Name: Basic Deduction
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level investigator feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Devotion
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level champion feat.

Name: Basic Dogma
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level cleric feat.

Name: Basic Druid Spellcasting
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits for druid spellcasting.

Name: Basic Flair
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level swashbuckler feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Fury
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level barbarian feat.

Name: Basic Hunter's Trick
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level ranger feat.

Name: Basic Kata
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level monk feat.

Name: Basic Maneuver
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level fighter feat.

Name: Basic Martial Magic
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level magus feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Muse's Whispers
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level bard feat.

Name: Basic Mysteries
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level oracle feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Oracle Spellcasting
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

Name: Basic Red Mantis Magic
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: Red Mantis Assassin Dedication; trained in Religion
Benefits: You have learned limited divine magic from your Red Mantis training.

Name: Basic Sorcerer Spellcasting
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits for sorcerer spellcasting.

Name: Basic Spellcasting
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You increase your ability to cast spells.

Name: Basic Synergy
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level summoner feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Trickery
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level rogue feat.

Name: Basic Wilding
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level druid feat.

Name: Basic Witch Spellcasting
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

Name: Basic Witchcraft
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level witch feat of your choice.

Name: Basic Wizard Spellcasting
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits for wizard spellcasting.

Name: Battle Assessment
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy’s strengths and weaknesses.

Name: Beast Speaker
Source: Pathfinder #152
Benefits: You can speak with animals.

Name: Bespell Weapon
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You siphon the residual energy from the last spell you cast into one weapon you’re wielding.

Name: Blessed Sacrifice
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the protector's sacrifice domain spell as a devotion spell.

Name: Bloodletting Claws
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon inflicts bleeding wounds on a telling blow.

Name: Bullying Staff
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: You can Shove and Trip larger creatures.

Name: Butterfly Blade Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You've trained in one of Goka's oldest traditions of espionage, intimidation, and combat mastery.

Name: Calculated Splash
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You have calculated all the angles to maximize a bomb’s splash.

Name: Call Bonded Item
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're mystically connected to your bonded item and can call it to your hand.

Name: Careful Explorer
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You gain a sixth sense for traps, noticing them even when you're not trying to.

Name: Cathartic Focus Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You learn the focus spell listed under your emotion's entry.

Name: Cavalier's Banner
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You fly the banner of your pledge from your mount, raising your allies' spirits.

Name: Cavalier's Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You Command an Animal to order your mount to Stride twice.

Name: Champion Resiliency
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: Champion Dedication; class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier
Benefits: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each champion archetype class feat you have.

Name: Channel Smite
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: harmful font or healing font
Benefits: You siphon the destructive energies of positive or negative energy through a melee attack and into your foe.

Name: Claws of the Dragon
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your fingernails grow into razor-sharp claws, and scales speckle your fingers, hands, and wrists.

Name: Cobra Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You enter a tight stance, coiled up like a lashing cobra with your hands poised as venomous fangs.

Name: Combat Reading
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use a performer's cold reading techniques, aura reading, and other tricks to discover your foe's strengths and weaknesses.

Name: Command Undead
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You grasp the animating force within an undead creature and bend it to your will.

Name: Companion's Cry
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can urge your companion to do its utmost.

Name: Contortionist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can squeeze out of tight situations surprisingly quickly, gaining an advantage against foes that try to pin you down.

Name: Courageous Advance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With a rousing call, you exhort an ally to advance.

Name: Cruelty
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: devotion spell (touch of corruption)
Benefits: The harm you deal with your corrupting touch saps the strength from your enemy's body.

Name: Crystal Keeper Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #148
Prerequisites: trained in Elven Lore or Society
Benefits: You can use Arcana, Occultism, Religion, or Society to Decipher Writing by meditating before a crystal, regardless of the type of writing.

Name: Crystal Ward Spells
Source: Pathfinder #148
Benefits: Your study of crystals and the energies held within a gem’s facets grants you special arcane crystal ward spells.

Name: Dead Reckoning
Source: PFS Guide
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; trained in Survival
Benefits: You've trained yourself to maintain a strong sense of direction at all times, even when you can't use a compass or see the sky above.

Name: Decry Thief
Source: Pathfinder #149
Benefits: When you attempt to Demoralize, you can make it harder for the target to flee, in place of the action’s normal effects.

Name: Defend Summoner
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon blocks attacks against you.

Name: Deflect Arrow
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your reflexes allow you to deflect ranged attacks.

Name: Deft Cooperation
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You gain a bonus to your own checks when Aiding an ally.

Name: Detective's Readiness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you're on a case, you stay watchful and resolute to avoid tricks your suspect might pull.

Name: Devastating Spellstrike
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: Arcane Cascade, inexorable iron hybrid study, Spellstrike
Benefits: Your Spellstrike sweeps are so wide and devastating, they splash onto nearby foes.

Name: Diabolic Certitude
Source: World Guide
Benefits: Your Hellknight training drilled details of Hell’s denizens deep into your mind.

Name: Directed Channel
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can shape the energy you channel in a single direction, reaching farther and in a more directed fashion.

Name: Disarming Block
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attempt to Disarm the creature whose attack you blocked of the weapon they attacked you with.

Name: Disrupt Prey
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Make a melee Strike against your prey.

Name: Distracting Flattery
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know how to maintain a good impression and manage your image, even while keeping uncouth company.

Name: Distracting Spellstrike
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: laughing shadow hybrid study, Spellstrike
Benefits: You weave distracting magic with one hand to enhance your Spellstrike.

Name: Disturbing Defense
Source: The Slithering
Benefits: Your internal organs and blood vessels have shifted and changed, and even you don't know precisely where in your body they are.

Name: Divine Access
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your ability to tap into divine magic surpasses the spells traditionally available to you (the divine spell list).

Name: Divine Evolution
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: The divine might provided by your bloodline flows through you.

Name: Divine Health
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your faith makes you resistant to disease.

Name: Doctor's Visitation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You move to provide immediate care to those who need it.

Name: Double Shot
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession.

Name: Dousing Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You enhance your spell with elemental water, soaking the target.

Name: Draconic Scent
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your sense of smell is uncanny, much like a dragon's.

Name: Dragon Arcana
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: ability to cast spells from spell slots; Dragon Disciple Dedication
Benefits: You've discovered how to add the magic of dragons to your tradition.

Name: Dread Marshal Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Putting on a grim face for the battle ahead, you encourage your allies to strike fear into their foes with vicious attacks.

Name: Dread Striker
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You capitalize on your enemies’ fear to slip past their defenses.

Name: Dual Energy Heart
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: A second energy dwells in your eidolon.

Name: Dual Thrower
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know how to throw two weapons as easily as strike with them.

Name: Dual-Handed Assault
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You snap your free hand over to grip your weapon just long enough to add momentum and deliver a more powerful blow to your opponent.

Name: Dual-Weapon Reload
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You carry your ammunition in a way that allows you to reload while holding two weapons.

Name: Duelist's Challenge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Select one foe that you can see and proclaim a challenge.

Name: Duelist's Edge
Source: World Guide
Benefits: Increase your initiative with the dueling sword.

Name: Efficient Alchemy (Alchemist)
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Thanks to the time you’ve spent studying and experimenting, you know how to scale your formulas into larger batches that don’t require any additional attention.

Name: Elaborate Flourish
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You embellish your spellcasting with entrancing flourishes and grand pronouncements, making it harder to identify or counter.

Name: Eldritch Nails
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your nails are supernaturally long and sharp.

Name: Elemental Familiar
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your familiar becomes an elemental spirit capable of taking on aspects of the four elements: air, earth, fire, or water.

Name: Elemental Summons
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can call the four elements to you.

Name: Emergency Targe
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You immediately Raise a Shield or cast shield.

Name: Enduring Alchemy
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You’ve learned how to make your personal energy last just a little bit longer when quickly brewing ad hoc concoctions.

Name: Environmental Explorer
Source: PFS Guide
Benefits: You've traversed enough untamed wilderness to gain an intuitive understanding of the dangers that exist in such places.

Name: Everstand Strike
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: Your follow-up blow leaves you an opening to set your shield.

Name: Expanded Domain Initiate
Source: Gods & Magic
Benefits: You have long venerated one of your deity’s lesser-known aspects

Name: Expert Backstabber
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you Strike a flat-footed foe with a weapon that has the backstabber weapon trait, you deal 2 extra precision damage instead of 1.

Name: Eye of Ozem
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: Lastwall Sentry Dedication; expert in Perception
Benefits: Learn how to better spot danger at a distance.

Name: Familiar Conduit
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Familiar Master Dedication; able to cast spells
Benefits: Under your tutelage, your familiar has grown attuned to the hidden currents of the world and can serve as a conduit for your magic.

Name: Familiar Mascot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your familiar is the heart and soul of your adventuring team.

Name: Fancy Moves
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You show off your fighting style to discourage your foes.

Name: Fane's Escape
Source: PFS Guide
Benefits: A good getaway requires a good distraction.

Name: Far Shot
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your experience in the field has taught you how to focus your aim at a distance.

Name: Farabellus Flip
Source: PFS Guide
Prerequisites: trained in medium armor; trained in Acrobatics
Benefits: Surprisingly agile even in a breastplate and carrying a full rucksack, Marcos Farabellus developed this evasive maneuver during one of his many adventures.

Name: Fast Movement
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your rage is a frenzy of rapid movements.

Name: Favored Enemy
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You have studied a specific type of wild creature and can hunt it more easily.

Name: Fighter Resiliency
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: Fighter Dedication; class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier
Benefits: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have.

Name: Finishing Precision
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned how to land daring blows when you have panache.

Name: Fire Resistance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your connection to heat and flame means that fire is reluctant to bring its full force to bear against you.

Name: Firebrand Braggart Dedication
Source: Character Guide
Prerequisites: second mark member of the Firebrands; Charisma 14
Benefits: Your Firebrand training has taught you that achieving something is more satisfying if you boast about it first.

Name: First Revelation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain your mystery's initial revelation spell.

Name: Flamboyant Athlete
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your panache allows you to perform incredible feats: climbing, swimming, and leaping far beyond your normal capacity.

Name: Fleet Tempo
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: To rush after a criminal or reach someone in need, you ring a sprightly tone.

Name: Flurry of Maneuvers
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You flurry is a combination of maneuvers.

Name: Flying Kick
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You launch yourself at a foe.

Name: Focused Juggler
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: You continue Juggling until the end of your next turn.

Name: Folktales Lore
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: You can pull bits of wisdom from any tale.

Name: Form Control
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: With additional care and effort, you can take on an alternate form for a longer period of time.

Name: Gossip Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your time gossiping in fashionable salons keeps you informed on every topic.

Name: Grave's Voice
Source: Pathfinder #163
Benefits: You can influence spirits and haunts

Name: Guarded Movement
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your guard is up, even while moving.

Name: Guardian's Deflection (Swashbuckler)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.

Name: Head Stomp
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Make an unarmed melee attack against a prone target.

Name: Heal Animal
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can heal your animal companion's wounds.

Name: Healing Bomb
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: By adding a special catalyst, you transform a healing elixir into a topical projectile.

Name: Healing Touch
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the appropriate devotion spell for your cause.

Name: Hidden Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Vigilante Dedication; expert in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: You've learned to hide the magical auras of your gear.

Name: Hideous Ululation
Source: The Slithering
Benefits: Your throat has multiple separate chambers that can give your voice an eerie echo.

Name: Hunter's Luck
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your recollection of monsters is magically enhanced by luck.

Name: Hurling Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make a ranged Strike with a thrown weapon you already have in your hand, Stride, and then Interact to draw another weapon.

Name: Hybrid Study Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Gain the conflux spell from a hybrid study of your choice.

Name: Impaling Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You stab two foes with a single thrust or bash them together with one punch.

Name: Impressive Mount
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've trained your mount to become a powerful force on the battlefield.

Name: Improved Communal Healing
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can direct excess channeled energy outward to benefit an ally.

Name: Improved Familiar (Witch)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You find it easy to attract a powerful and unusual familiar to your side.

Name: Improvised Pummel
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make a Strike with your wielded improvised weapon.

Name: Initial Eidolon Ability
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your link to your eidolon becomes stronger, granting it a new ability.

Name: Inspire Defense
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You learn to protect yourself and your allies with your performance.

Name: Inspiring Marshal Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You become a brilliant example of dedication and poise in battle, encouraging your allies to follow suit.

Name: Investigate Haunting
Source: Pathfinder #163
Benefits: You are skilled at noticing the telltale signs of ghosts and hauntings.

Name: Investigator's Stratagem
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You play out battles in your head, allowing you to strike when the time is right.

Name: Jalmeri Heavenseeker Dedication
Source: Pathfinder #158
Benefits: Your skill and dedication have set you on a path to master the techniques of Jalmeray's greatest martial artists.

Name: Ka Stone Ritual
Source: World Guide
Prerequisites: Living Monolith Dedication; a sphinx or living monolith with this feat performs a ritual with you
Benefits: You enchant your ka stone and can use it to wield magic.

Name: Knockdown
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them.

Name: Kreighton's Cognitive Crossover
Source: PFS Guide
Benefits: Kreighton teaches his students that an agile mind can glean clues leading to the truth, even from the most unlikely of sources.

Name: Leading Dance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You sweep your foe into your dance.

Name: Leshy Familiar Secrets
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The leaf order's secrets allow your familiar to take advantage of its leshy form.

Name: Lie Detector
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: empiricism methodology or interrogation methodology
Benefits: You're adept at noticing the tells of a liar—sweat, flushing, a quavering voice, a quickening pulse.

Name: Lifelink Surge
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You learn the lifelink surge link spell.

Name: Light of Revelation
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: You’ve learned to call upon light to reveal what is hidden.

Name: Linked Focus
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: arcane bond; arcane school
Benefits: You have linked your bonded item to the well of energy that powers your school spells.

Name: Log Roll
Source: Pathfinder #153
Benefits: You shuffle your feet to dislodge the surface beneath you or otherwise cause your opponent to become unsteady.

Name: Lost in the Crowd
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You’ve learned how to move as one with crowds and hide among them.

Name: Magic Warrior Aspect
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You can alter your form to gain an aspect of the animal your mask represents.

Name: Magic Warrior Transformation
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You can transform fully into the animal your mask represents.

Name: Magical Edification
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned those tidbits of magic that are most conducive to furthering your acquisition and transmission of knowledge.

Name: Magical Scholastics
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: While study is key to your success, a bit of magic is a helpful tool in discovering the secrets of the past.

Name: Magical Trickster
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can sneak spells past your foes’ defenses as easily as any blade.

Name: Mask Familiar
Source: Character Guide
Benefits: Your mask takes on a personality of its own, allowing it to serve as your familiar.

Name: Mature Animal Companion (Druid)
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion, which grants it additional capabilities.

Name: Mature Beastmaster Companion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: All of your animal companions grow up, becoming mature animal companions and gaining additional capabilities.

Name: Melodious Spell
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You subtly weave your spellcasting into your performance.

Name: Mercy
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Your touch relieves fear and restores movement.

Name: Minion Guise
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: animal companion or familiar; Vigilante Dedication; expert in Deception
Benefits: When you are in your social identity, you can also grant a social identity to an animal companion, familiar, or other minion.

Name: Monk Resiliency
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: Monk Dedication; class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier
Benefits: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each monk archetype class feat you have.

Name: Mortification
Source: World Guide
Benefits: Your reckonings have prepared your body for physical punishment.

Name: Mug
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make a quick attack and rob your foe in the process.

Name: Multilingual Cipher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use multiple languages to create and break codes.

Name: Natural Swimmer
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Water flows around you, letting you cut through the waves as if born to it.

Name: Necromantic Resistance
Source: World Guide
Benefits: Gain resistance to necromancy effects and damage.

Name: Necrotic Infusion
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You pour negative energy into your undead subject to empower its attacks.

Name: Never Tire
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: As long as you have an audience, you can continue to perform.

Name: Observant Explorer
Source: PFS Guide
Benefits: You've gained an intuitive sense about creatures.

Name: Occult Evolution
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Glimpses of the obscure secrets of the universe loan you power.

Name: Ongoing Investigation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're always investigating what's around you, even as you perform other activities.

Name: Opportunist
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the Attack of Opportunity reaction.

Name: Order Magic
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.

Name: Order Spell
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the initial order spell from your order.

Name: Orthographic Mastery
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You understand the principles that underlie all written words, allowing you to read nearly any text.

Name: Oversized Throw
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With a great heave, you seize a piece of your surroundings, such as a boulder, log, table, wagon, or chunk of earth, and hurl it at your foes.

Name: Parting Shot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You jump back and fire a quick shot that catches your opponent off guard.

Name: Peafowl Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You enter a tall and proud stance while remaining mobile, with all the grace and composure of a peafowl.

Name: Perfect Strike
Source: World Guide
Benefits: You call upon insight from your training to recover accuracy.

Name: Phonetic Training
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can pronounce and repeat words with near-perfect accuracy even if you don't understand their meaning.

Name: Pirate Weapon Training
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're particularly skilled at wielding traditional pirate weapons.

Name: Play to the Crowd
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You show off for the crowd.

Name: Poison Weapon
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You apply poison to a weapon.

Name: Poisoner's Twist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Poisons attack specific parts of the body.

Name: Posse
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: By spending 1 minute giving guidance to help hunt down your prey, you instruct up to five willing creatures to assist you.

Name: Poultice Preparation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you create an herbal elixir, you can prepare it as a poultice instead.

Name: Powerful Shove
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can push larger foes around with your attack.

Name: Predictable!
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: By observing an opponent, you can get a sense of their next move and prepare to counter or resist it.

Name: Primal Evolution
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You can call upon the creatures of the wild for aid.

Name: Quick Alchemy
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You gain the Quick Alchemy action.

Name: Quick Fix
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can attach a talisman using only a bit of glue and some string.

Name: Quick Juggler
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: When you start to Juggle or add another item to those you are Juggling, you add two items instead of one.

Name: Quick Mount
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You and your mount can spring into action at a moment's notice.

Name: Quick Reversal
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: You turn your foes’ flanking against them with a quick reverse.

Name: Quick Shot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You draw your bow and attack with the same action.

Name: Quick Study
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: During your daily preparations, you can study a particular subject to gain the trained proficiency rank in one Lore skill of your choice.

Name: Radiant Infusion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You pour invigorating positive energy into a living ally.

Name: Raging Athlete
Source: Core Rulebook
Benefits: Physical obstacles can’t hold back your fury.

Name: Ranger Resiliency
Source: Core Rulebook
Prerequisites: Ranger Dedication; class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier
Benefits: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have.
